column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) ), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: SOC
column.comment: Service order code used to calculate the amount associated with the characteristic.

column.name: TARGET_TARIFF
column.comment: This field contains the target tariff option.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: effective change date

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: SPECIAL_DAY_SET_CODE
column.comment: Defines a reference to a specific group of special days.

column.name: PERIOD_SET_CODE
column.comment: A user-defined code used as a unique identifier for a billing period set.

column.name: PRODUCT_FAMILY
column.comment: This attribute identifies a Product Family.

column.name: SOC_STATUS
column.comment: This attribute defines whether the SOC or Price Plan (PP) preparation has been completed (Active) or is currently in-work (Draft). SOCs or PPs that are active can be sold to customers, depending on the SOC entity effective and expiration dates. SOCs or PPs that are in-work status cannot be sold until they are changed to active. The SOC or PP status can change from in-work to active, but not from active to in-work.  A  Active  I   In-work

column.name: SALE_EFF_DATE
column.comment: effective change date

column.name: SALE_EXP_DATE
column.comment: Expiry Date

column.name: SOC_DESC_SEQ
column.comment: This field points to entries in the BILL_DESC entity containing a description of the respective item in different languages.

column.name: SOC_RC_BILL_ORDER
column.comment: This attribute is used by the Bill Formatter to determine the RC order on the bill.

column.name: SERVICE_TYPE
column.comment: Typing of the service according to price plan, SOC, promotional SOC etc. Valid values ​​are: P - Price Plan, M - Reduced Price Plan, R - Regular SOC, S - Reduced SOC, O - Optional SOC, B - Buy-One-Get -One SOC, T - Toll RS, L - Toll SOC for RC.

column.name: SPECIAL_PURPOSE_SOC
column.comment: There are two types of  SOC which act differently in the system:  · FNF SOC - This is a special SOC holding only F&F Features. Only one F&F SOC is allowed for a user. An F&F SOC must contain member quantities and the black list. F&F SOC is also subject to OTC when the subscriber migrates from one F&F SOC to another. · Group SOC - This is a special SOC containing Features to support calls within a Group. Only Group Features, identified by Group Feature type, can be attached to this Group SOC.  Group SOC can only be attached to a Tariff Option in a special field. When the subscriber joins a Group, this SOC is deployed, by CSM, to the customer tables. · EPABX - Special SOC created to rate EPABX added to a Group Master.  Valid Values: · F - FNF SOC · G - Group SOC · E - EPABX · Null - regular

column.name: SOC_LEVEL_CODE
column.comment: Indicator above the SOC is defined at the account or participant level. C - subscriber level B - BAN level

column.name: FOR_SALE_IND
column.comment: This attribute defines whether this price plan can be sold to customers.

column.name: INTERNAL_TYPE
column.comment: This attribute defines the types of internal SOCs, i.e., SOCs that are not for sale. An internal SOC may be a Market Default SOC, a Competition SOC, a Roaming Outcollect SOC, a SOC for Attempts' definitions or a SOC for defining RC for Toll R.S.. · D - Market Default · I - Roaming Incollect · O - Roaming Outcollect · T - Tariff Default

column.name: MIN_REQ_CTNS
column.comment: If there is a Price Plan requirement for the minimum number of CTNs, this number overrides the Price Plan.

column.name: MIN_PER_FTR_CAT_IND
column.comment: This attribute indicates whether the minimum performance will be for all feature-related charges/minutes or for a group of feature categories (defined in Min_Perf_Ftr_Category entity).  Valid values: · G - Group of feature categories · T - Total feature related charge/minutes

column.name: EU_MIN_REQ_USG_CHRG
column.comment: This attribute defines the minimum monthly charge (minimum performance) that the customer is to be charged as a feature-related charge, to be eligible for the Price Plan, i.e., the amount determined in this entity is the minimum  charge for the customer who purchased this Price Plan.

column.name: EU_ET_MAX_PEN_RATE
column.comment: This field defines the maximum early termination penalty in Euro that can be issued for this price plan. When a zero value is defined, no maximum penalty limit is issued.

column.name: EU_ET_MIN_PEN_RATE
column.comment: This field defines the maximum early termination penalty in Euro that can be issued for this price plan. When a zero value is defined, no maximum penalty limit is issued.

column.name: PP_MIN_MOU_PRD_IND
column.comment: This attribute indicates whether the minimum usage of the features in the PP is sensitive to Minutes Of Usage (MOU), and, if so, whether to relate to the MOU as combined or per period. When the PP is sensitive to MOU, a defined quantity of usage minutes (by period or combined) must be produced by the subscriber/BAN. When the actual number of usage minutes is less than the amount defined in the MOU entity, a penalty is issued. The number of MOU is populated in MOU_BY_PERIOD entity. The penalty for each missing minute will be defined in PP_UC_RATE (feature code

column.name: ET_REM_MONTH_PEN_TP
column.comment: The Early Termination penalty may be defined as a combination of a fixed rate defined in PP_OC_RATE (with feature code PNETRM) and a remaining-month dependent rate. The remaining-month dependent rate is either the PP RC defined in PP_RC_RATE or the minimum usage charges.  Both parts are optional, but the penalty rating must consist of at least one component. M -The penalty amount is the number of months remaining until the commitment date multiplied by a monthly rate. R -The penalty amount is the number of months remaining until the commitment date multiplied by the price plan recurring charge (there is a special formula for that). I -The penalty amount is the number of months remaining until the commitment date multiplied by the price plan minimum requirements (there is a special formula for that). N - The penalty rate is not remaining-months dependent - flat rate.

column.name: MIN_REQ_USG_LEVEL
column.comment: This attribute defines the level of the minimum requirements. When the minimum terms are defined at the subscriber level, the system checks the minimum requirements against the specific subscriber usage. When it is at the BAN level, the check is against the usage by all the BAN's subscribers together or for each subscriber individually.  A - Average to BAN Subscribers  B - total usage of the BAN's subscriber s  C - subscriber's usage

column.name: DLR_COMMISSION_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether a SOC is a Common SOC that should be attached to the subscriber during activation upon the selection of the common_soc option by the CSR.

column.name: DLR_RESIDUAL_IND
column.comment: N/A. For future use.

column.name: EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: Expiry Date

column.name: SOC_DESCRIPTION
column.comment: description

column.name: BLACK_LIST_CD
column.comment: In the case of an F&F SOC or a Group Master PP, a Black List code indicates the restricted numbers for participating in the F&F SOC.

column.name: EFF_VERSION_IND
column.comment: This attribute indicates whether the new version takes place immediately (starting from the version Eff date) or at the beginning of the next customer cycle. Valid Values: I - Immediate N - Next cycle

column.name: ROUNDING_RULE_CD
column.comment: Rounding rule code is the link to the default rounding rule containing minimum call duration and the subsequent rounding factor

column.name: CONTRACT_TYPE
column.comment: The contract type associated with the SOC, refers to CONTRACT_TYPE table.

column.name: AUTO_PROLOG_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether adding this SOC will trigger automatic prolongation of the voice contract.

column.name: MIN_CONTRACT_REQ
column.comment: Minimum contract period required before the SOC can be added (in months).

column.name: SPCL_SUBSIDY_TYPE
column.comment: Special subsidy code.

column.name: COMMON_SOC_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether a SOC is a Common SOC that should be attached to the subscriber during activation upon the selection of the common_soc option by the CSR.

column.name: SK_RELEVANT_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the OTC feature will be presented in the drop down list of OTCs that can be waived for a specific skeleton condition.

column.name: CSM_SELECTION_IND
column.comment: Indicator representing a selection criteria for CSM and Skeleton Area - A > All K > Skeleton N > Non Skeleton S > Specific Skeleton

column.name: ALLOW_CANCEL_BAN
column.comment: Indicator whether a BAN can be automatically cancelled or not

column.name: SK_PLAUS_SEVERITY_IND
column.comment: Indicator for providing an information to users - E  > Error W > Warning Can be populated only when CSM_ SELECTION_ IND is S or K or N

column.name: SMS_IND
column.comment: Indicates if SMS need to be sent when adding, deleting or replacing the SOC (Y

column.name: CAMPAIGN_RELEVANT
column.comment: indicates whether soc is campaign relevant

column.name: BPN_IND
column.comment: Indicates if BPN relevant. - Indicates if BPN relevant, Y/N

column.name: AGING_MODE
column.comment: This field indicates, that aging needs to send a feature to UPS for the SOC. If the field is empty, aging will not be involved.

column.name: ONLINE_MESSAGE_CODE
column.comment: The message code of the online message that should be displayed in CSM Online on expiration of the SOC.

column.name: LETTER_IND
column.comment: letter_ind ( to be changed )

column.name: AUTO_EXP_POLICY
column.comment: Auto Expiration Policy

column.name: SPEC_ACTION
column.comment: special_soc_action ( to be changed )

column.name: ROUTING_INFO
column.comment: Contains additional routing information; possible content: 4 values, each 3 characters long, separated by comma - Routing Information for EAI. Contains additional routing information; possible content: : 4 values, each 3 characters long, separated by comma

column.name: BUNDLE_CATEGORY_ID
column.comment: Bundle Category ID (Valid Values:0 - Out Of Bundle,1- Voice,10 - Data,11 - Voice & Data,100 - Messaging,101 - Voice & Messaging,110 - Data & Messaging,111 - Integrated,9999 - Initial Value)

column.name: XTRA_HANDLE_IND
column.comment: Contains: ‘MDT’ - MDM Team, ‘MDB’ - MDM Business or ‘MDE’ - MDM Enterprise - Contains: ''''MDT'''' - MDM Team ''''MDB'''' - MDM Business ''''MDE'''' - MDM Enterprise, This field indicates that the current SOC has supplementary properties defined in SOC_XTRA_HANDLING table. The SOCs for which this indicator is populated have one matching effective record in SOC_XTRA_HANDLING table

column.name: CTCCORR_VALUE
column.comment: CTC correction value for Tariff Level
